isis.stitle: 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14613 - DISASSEMBLE - AUXILIARY SECTION

step1.para: Remove the range piston from the cylinder bore ( Figure 99). If necessary, remove the O-rings from the I.D. and O.D. position ( inset, Figure 99).

figure.caption: Figure 99. Remove Range Piston and O-Rings From I.D. and O.D. Position

step1.para: Remove bolts and range cylinder housing ( Figure 100).

figure.caption: Figure 100. Remove Bolts and Range Cylinder Housing

step1.para: If necessary, remove the small O-ring from the range cylinder housing bore ( Figure 101).

figure.caption: Figure 101. Remove Small O-Ring From Range Cylinder Housing Bore

step1.para: Place the larger low range synchronizer ring on the bench. Cover the assembly with a shop rag to prevent losing the three springs released from the high range synchronizer at the pin locations. Pull the high range synchronizer from the blocker pins ( Figure 103).

figure.caption: Figure 103. Pull High Range Synchronizer From Blocker Pins

step1.para: Remove the sliding clutch from the synchronizer ring low range pins ( Figure 104).

figure.caption: Figure 104. Remove Sliding Clutch From Synchronizer Ring Low Range Pins

svcsubproc.title: Output Shaft and Rear Bearing Assemblies

step1.para: Remove the bearing inner spacer from the output shaft ( Figure 105).

figure.caption: Figure 105. Remove Bearing Inner Spacer From Output Shaft

step1.para: Use the front face of the deep reduction gear as a base and press the output shaft through the bearing and gear ( Figure 106). This frees the bearing, low range gear, and the splined washer.

figure.caption: Figure 106. Press Output Shaft Through Bearing and Gear

step1.para: Remove the stepped washer, low range gear and splined washer from the shaft ( Figure 107).

figure.caption: Figure 107. Remove Stepped Washer, Low Range Gear and Splined Washer

step1.para: Remove the rear bearing retaining bolts, rear bearing cover and gasket from the auxiliary housing ( Figure 108). The rear bearing cone drops from the housing bore when the cover is removed. If necessary, remove the oil seal from the cover ( inset, Figure 108).

figure.caption: Figure 108. Remove Rear Bearing Retaining Bolts, Rear Bearing Cover and Gasket and Remove Oil Seal

step1.para: Remove the two bearing cups and spacer from the bearing bore ( Figure 109).

figure.caption: Figure 109. Remove Bearing Cups and Spacer From Bearing Bore

step1.para: If necessary, remove the insert valve retaining nut and remove insert valve from the bore ( Figure 110).

figure.caption: Figure 110. Remove Insert Valve Retaining Nut and Insert Valve

step1.para: Pull the yoke bar from the cylinder housing ( Figure 111). If necessary, remove the O-ring from the piston O.D. ( inset, Figure 111).

figure.caption: Figure 111. Pull Yoke Bar From Cylinder Housing and Remove O-Ring From Piston O.D.

step1.para: If necessary, remove the small O-ring from the cylinder housing bore ( Figure 112).

figure.caption: Figure 112. Remove Small O-Ring From Cylinder Housing Bore
